body: Have you had a chance to play with [pudb](http://pypi.python.org/pypi/pudb) yet?  I'm not sure if it does precisely what you have in mind, but it's a much more powerful debugger than pdb (and ipdb is only a minimally improved pdb)...

@ernop

A `skip` argument to `pdb.PDB` that accepts a list of globs was added in v2.7.

> The skip argument, if given, must be an iterable of glob-style module name patterns. The debugger will not step into frames that originate in a module that matches one of these patterns.

It would be great if we could set the `skip` list from `.pdbrc` (or from `${PDB_SKIP}`).
- http://docs.python.org/library/pdb.html#pdb.Pdb
- http://docs.python.org/library/bdb.html (`bdb.Bdb(skip=[globstr])`) (-> orderedSet)
- http://hg.python.org/cpython/file/9877c25d9556/Lib/pdb.py#l144 (`pdb.PDB(completekey='tab', stdin=None, stdout=None, skip=[globstr], nosigint=False)`)
- http://hg.python.org/cpython/file/9877c25d9556/Lib/bdb.py#l102 (`is_skipped_module`)
- https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/master/IPython/core/debugger.py#L193

EDIT: https://github.com/westurner/ipython/compare/debugger_skip_list?expand=1

@fperez 
`%run -t pudb <script.py>` is great (thanks!), I'm looking for this sort of functionality with nose-ipdb (ipdbplugin), (which drops into the debugger on test failure and exception, making [further] test development very simple, [though magic commands like `%logstart` do not work from within `ipdb`](https://github.com/gotcha/ipdb/issues/33)),
- which calls [`IPython.core.debugger`](https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/master/IPython/core/debugger.py)
- which looks for [`pydb`](https://github.com/rocky/pydb) (`try/except:`)
- which has been superseded by [`pydbgr`](https://code.google.com/p/pydbgr/) (edit: [this thread](http://mail.scipy.org/pipermail/ipython-user/2010-January/thread.html#6804), [`ipy_pydbgr.py`](https://code.google.com/p/pydbgr/source/browse/ipython/ipy_pydbgr.py))
- which looks really cool

This is a bit OT, but would you be opposed to adding configuration options for e.g. `skip_list` and something like `default_debugger`?
